description: Yuri M. Luzhkov is a leader of Russia’s resurgent nationalists who doubles as mayor of Moscow. His influence now extends outside the nation’s current borders.
title: Russia’s Mayor
title_page: Russia’s Mayor - The New York Times
text:
Men and women dressed in traditional South Ossetian clothing waited to greet Mayor Yuri Luzhkov of Moscow earler this month, on his first visit to the separatist enclave. South Ossetian separatists hail Mr. Luzhkov as a liberator, and he is so popular that a street was named after him in Tskhinvali, the capital.
James Hill for The New York Times
